direction.raw_text: The two Humvees roll along the narrow, twisting trail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly drives, Deakins beside him, Johnson and Pritchett in back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You a fan of boxing, Mr. Pritchett?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's barbaric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, too! I love it! Two men trying to do as much damage to the other as he can. As basic as you can get, don't you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it should be banned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do I! God, wouldn't that make it more exciting? Having to go into dark alleys and basements to see a fight? I bet we see eye-to- eye on a lot of things, Mr. Pritchett. Deakins grins; Mr. Pritchett steams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale and Terry stand on an outcropping overlooking the 4WD trail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two Humvees make their way along the trail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See the one in front? It just has a driver? They wanted to keep the weight down. It has the nukes. Hale takes Terry's gun from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna shoot out the tires?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Humvees can reseal and inflate with the flick of a switch. That's why Deak chose 'em. Terry looks at Hale -- then what is he going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna steal it. (checks gun) You get to a phone and call McMurran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The nearest phone is a two-hour walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you better start walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I know my way around here. You're gonna need me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very serious) I appreciate what you've done so far. But now it gets hairy. Go to the phone. He scrambles off over the rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come around a corner. The trail hugs the face of a ten-foot- high cliff. Suddenly, from off the cliff...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jump down onto the roof of the lead Humvee. Hale looks at Terry, angry. But before he can say anything...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baker swerves, trying to throw them off. He pulls out a pistol, shoots up through the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullets punch up. Hale pulls out the gun. It falls from his hand. Terry grabs it as a sharp swerve sends...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flying. He lands hard behind the Humvee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins points at Hale, getting to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sprints after the leading Humvee. Deakins' Humvee closes fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks back, sees Hale's predicament.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here! She slides the pistol along the truck roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grabs the gun out of the air as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slams on the brakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comes flying off the top, landing on the hood, barely holding on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is going to be crushed between the Humvees. He jumps up, turning, as the bumpers come together. He lands on the tailgate facing backwards and fires into Deakins' windshield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly ducks below the dash and slams on the brakes but Deakins doesn't flinch. The bullets bounce off the glass --bulletproof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baker sticks his gun out the window and aims at Terry and starts to pull the trigger when he stops, feeling a gun against the back of his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is behind him. Hale gets into the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme the gun and get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I think we got ourselves a little stand-off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we don't. Hale shoots Baker in the thigh. Baker howls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reaches forward and grabs Baker's gun as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kicks Baker out of the Humvee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad timing for him. He tumbles out, right in front of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And is run over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holds the steering wheel, yells to Terry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You drive!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climbs into the Humvee, takes the wheel from Hale. She jams Baker's gun into her belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd yell at you for coming after me, but you did just save my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's a look between them, then Hale climbs into the back. He finds what he is looking for -- a jerry can of gasoline and an emergency tool box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doing, Hale?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale keeps his back to the other Humves. He pulls gaffer's tape off a roll, tears it with his teeth, grabs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of the tool kit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he'll set off a nuke. That'd show us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale tosses the jerry can of gasoline out the back of the Humvee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flies through the air. There's a burning flare taped to the side of the plastic can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the plastic of the can bubbles and melts and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! But it's too late and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Explodes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skids to a stop, showered with burning gasoline. Deakins and his men bail out. Kelly, Johnson and Pritchett run for cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coolly grabs a fire extinguisher and starts spraying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale climbs up into the front seat. Terry looks at him, genuinely impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need somewhere to hide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know a place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins keeps spraying the burning Humvee with foam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terry and Hale have taken the Humvee to the parking area in front of an abandoned mine. The winch on the Humvee strains. The cable is attached to the handles on the padlocked metal doors. The doors are slowly pulling out, groaning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a copper mine, barely squeaking along for years. They shut it-down a few months ago when they hit an underground river. The hinges on the metal doors buckle and snap and the doors rip loose. Hale shuts down the winch, unhooks it from the doors. He motions for Terry to drive it in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terry drives the Humvee into the mineshaft entrance. Hale uses a flashlight to look around. He finds a switch a flips it. A gas generator comes to life. Another click and lights come on. Now they can see the rest of the entry area, including a wire- mesh-enclosed elevator. As Terry looks around, Hale grabs the Humvee radio, tries to tune in other frequencies, gives up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hardwired in their frequency. We can't call out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we gonna do? Hale goes to the back of the Humvee, pulls down the tailgate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna take away Deakins' reason for being here. Hale grabs a screwdriver from the tool kit and pries open a panel on the side of one of the B-83s.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EL There's an LCD DISPLAY, a NUMERIC KEYPAD and a CLOCK showing the current time. The keys are oversized and brightly colored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fisher-Price makes nuclear weapons?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're designed to be used by guys wearing gloves in Alaska. He reaches in, hits a key and the LCD display lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These nukes have security codes. If you enter the wrong code three times, the nuke goes dead -- all the circuitry shorts out and shuts down. Kind of like the security systems with car radios.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And people say the public doesn't benefit from defense spending.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hand me the radio. Terry goes for the radio mike. Hale sees something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sticking out from under one of the nukes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulls it out, looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's from "St. Judes Hospital, Radiology Department."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale turns to Terry as she pulls over the radio mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's St. Judes Hospital?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fire is out. The radio crackles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Deak -- you there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Deakins and Kelly look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Ding, ding, ding, Deak. We're starting a new round. You took the first couple, but I've got you on the ropes now, you son of bitch. Deakins gets in the passenger side, grabs the radio mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, there. What was that last part? There was some static. (clicks off mike; to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Find them. (to Pritchett and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Let's go! Johnson pulls out a radiation detector scanner like the one Rhodes used. Kelly and Pritchett get back in the vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly drives Deakins' Humvee along the trail as they talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you're stalling while you try to find the nukes with your scanner, but you're gonna be too late. Hear that? Hale holds the radio mike up to the keypad as he enters numbers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm entering the wrong code, you bastard. A couple more times and these are gonna be useless to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really got me there. I sure didn't think of that. Hale slows down -- something's wrong -- Deakins doesn't cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All that time we spent in the cockpit together and you think I'm stupid? I got some new boards and circuits from a friend at Pantex. But nice try. Hale curses to himself. Terry looks at him. He shakes his head they're in trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Hale, I thought of asking you to join me on this. You wanna know why I didn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I would've said no?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would've just killed you if you said no. I was more afraid you'd say yes. Because I knew I couldn't count on you. You can pretend you've got guts, but when and if it comes down to it, you're gonna run off crying like a little girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better hope that's true, Doak. Because I've got the nukes, and there's nothing to stop me from entering the right code, if you know what I mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flash of worry) You wouldn't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah. You're right. I wouldn't have the guts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Hale drops the mike; looks at the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How deep is this mine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. A couple thousand feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's deep enough. Hale opens the elevator gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A nuclear explosion. Terry's jaw drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DEAKINS' HUMVEE Kelly drives the blackened Humvee as fast as he can. Johnson looks at his scanner, grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got it! They're -- DEAKINS In the mine. (off their looks) I could tell he was inside something. There was an echo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale hurries to the back of the Humvee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can still hide them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got a scanner. He'd find them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're talking about setting off a nuclear weapon!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They set them off underground in Nevada all through the fifties and sixties. There's no risk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell it to the two-headed cows. Hale grabs the straps around one of the nukes, pulls. He can barely move the thing. He turns to Terry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I am not helping you set off a nuclear weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We won't be down there when it goes off. This isn't a suicide mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Fine. Though I think you should know, before I ejected, I heard Deakins say the nukes were going to be used to wipe out the last few remaining handicapped gay whales. Terry looks at him -- you asshole. Hale looks at her, very serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need your help. Terry thinks, shakes her head, steps up and grabs the nuke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Humvee takes the turn-off to the mine entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale and Terry are going down with the nukes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When we get to the bottom we'll have to get away from this shaft. It'll limit the amount of radiation released into-the atmosphere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins's Humvee comes into the clearing. The Humvee stops and Deakins and Kelly jump out, followed by Pritchett and Johnson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator comes down. Hale slides open the gate. He and Terry drag the nukes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll each drag one down a tunnel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm only going to set off one. We'll leave the other one here. It'll be buried under a billion tons of rock. They are startled when the elevator starts going up behind them
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We better hurry. (nods down tunnel) Let's try down there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They start hauling the nuke down the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins, Pritchett, Kelly and Johnson wait by the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't wait to see how this fits into your plan. Deakins' charm peels away for an instant and he fixes Pritchett with a stare. Pritchett shrinks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baird, the Chairman and the others are watching large TV monitors. Creeley walks them through what they're looking at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wide-view, bird's-eye, thermal image of rocky terrain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the KH-12 satellite's infrared view of the area. An exposed nuclear core would be relatively hot -- it'd show as a circle of bright white. As you can see, there's nothing. The only heat signatures we found were these. The image changes. There are four blotches, glowing a dull red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's --?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We think it's Colonel Rhodes and his men. Their bodies. A look between Baird and the Chairman. The Chairman reaches for a phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilkins is on the phone. Giles looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was I right? Wilkins nods. Giles grins smugly for about half a second, then realizes what it really means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) I've got ten ships ready to go ... We should be hearing from NEST any minute now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flying over Canyonlands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins, Kelly and Johnson are in the elevator. Kelly holds a small metal briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale and Terry have stopped at the end of a tunnel. Hale has opened the guts of the nuke. He's pulling out a chip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know how to do this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pilots who fly with nuclear weapons have standing orders to ... (quoting from the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) ... "retrieve if possible, disable if necessary and destroy if we must," and destroy I must. He stands, looks around. He sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screwed into the cross beaus on the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna need your belt and one of your socks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator descends into view. Deakins, Kelly and Johnson get out. They see the other nuke lying there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Send it up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes head) Let's take care of Hale first. Spread out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In one hand Hale holds Terry's sock, filled with sand. His other hand grips the eyebolt. Terry is giving Hale a log up, straining under the weight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take your time. Really. Hale has pushed the open end of the sock through the eyebolt. He tightens a belt around the open end of the sock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Terry lets Hale down. Hale picks up a big rock and loops the free end of the belt around it. Then he picks up a smaller rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One chip has been pulled out of a circuit board. Hale very gingerly lays the small rock on top of the chip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We make a small hole in the sock, and when enough sand drains out -- and we're hopefully in New Mexico -- the sock is pulled through the eyebolt, the rock drops... (re: smaller rock) ... hitting the rock on this chip, closing the firing circuit and that's it. Hale finishes putting the small rock in position. He stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much time are we going to have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know precisely. This isn't a Swiss sock. Ten minutes, maybe -- Hale is cut off by...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flying in, ricocheting off the rock walls, fired by...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty yards down the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dive to the ground. They pull pistols, start shooting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of Johnson's bullets cuts through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feels sand hitting his face, looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sand is draining out of the sock very fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reaches up to grab the big rock, but Johnson sends a spray of bullets in. Terry grabs Hale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sock -- More bullets. Terry pulls Hale. They run down a side passage. Hale and Terry fire back at Johnson as they run out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoots after them, then runs up to the weapon. He reaches for the rock, stops -- maybe that'll set it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last sand pours out; the sock is sucked through the eye-bolt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drops fast toward the nuke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grabs it, stopping it just in time. The hand belongs to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at Johnson in disgust, exhales, and tosses the rock. He pulls out a walkie-talkie, clicks on, talks into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're at the end of tunnel three. (clicks off; to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) You two get this one set. I'll take the other one up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running along a tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat 'em back to the elevator. Stop 'em from getting out. Terry nods. They hurry off around a corner and are met by...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fired by...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With his Uzi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run back down the side tunnel, bullets winging off the rock all around them, shooting back. Hale starts shooting out the lights, plunging the tunnel into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slows down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bit with the sock was good. I like it. Still, I'm gonna use the the Field Expedient Tactical Timer. It's a little more precise. (BEAT) See, Hale -- you aren't the only one who's thought of setting off a nuke in this mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly is there with Johnson. Kelly flips on a lamp on a headstrap, giving him better light as he opens up the metal briefcase he's been carrying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An elaborate electronic timer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins pulls out a fresh clip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a demonstration. Otherwise, some swinging dick in Washington is going to say I don't have the balls or the ability to set off a nuclear weapon. I'm gonna show these puppies I'm ready, willing and able. Hell, I'm eager. Deakins jams in his clip, walks into the dark part of the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the dark, waiting to ambush Deakins and then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Opens fire -- but not at Hale and Terry -- at the cable along the ceiling connecting the lights. The cable snaps and electrical sparks shoot out, flooding the tunnel with light, showing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly exposed to Deakins' fire. The bullets whiz in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The muzzle flashes from his Uzi give away his position and Hale and Terry's bullets scream in at him. He backs around a corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take cover. It's a stand-off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Hale, I better be going. Look at it this way, partner. If you wanted to get closer to God, you are about to get your wish. Hale hears Deakins' footsteps start off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna ransom Salt Lake City, aren't you? The footsteps stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you think that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's where St. Judes Hospital is. You're gonna hide the nukes near the radiology department so they won't show up an any satellite radiation scans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much are you gonna ask for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough. I've got a broker in Stockholm. Monday morning he's going to buy me five percent of Volvo. For the rest of my days I'm going to live off the dividends, happy in the knowledge I'm helping to build the safest car in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So that's it? You're just doing 'this for the money? I'm kind of disappointed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would you do it, Hale?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the thing -- I wouldn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you were me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I were you...? (thinks, starts in) Because ... because I got passed over for promotion and goddamnit I'm going to show the bastards that I'm smarter than them all. (getting angry) Because ... everyone's selling out and cashing in, so why not me? (ANGRIER) Because ... because my ex-wife was sleeping around. Because my parents abused me. Because I ate some sugar. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (FURIOUS) Because I don't like Mondays. (takes a breath,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) It's all bullshit, Deak. There are no reasons. Not really. There's no difference between you and the guy who shoots up the schoolyard with an M-16. You both think you have reasons. You both think you were wronged. The truth? You're both just fucked in the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grim, evil -- fades into darkness as he turns and walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hear footsteps, receding. Hale bolts out of their hiding spot. Terry follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins gets to the elevator, drags the other nuke in, shuts the gate and starts up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly finishes keying in numbers into the nuke timer. An amber light comes on and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Starts ticking down from ton minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grab their guns and run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator comes up. Deakins drags out the nuke, hits the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: button, shuts the gate. The elevator descends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Pritchett!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale and Terry are waiting for the elevator to come down when...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run in. A half-second of surprise is broken when...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comes down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make a move toward the elevator, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unload with their Uzis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back around a corner, side by side, shooting their pistols.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is shot, drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grabs Johnson's Uzi and, firing both guns, backs to the elevator, kicks open the gate with his foot and gets inside. He hits the UP button with the butt of one of the guns and the elevator starts to rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Step out of the tunnel and fire on the climbing elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven minutes and counting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins and Pritchett get the nuke into the back of the Humvee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can go back, try to shut it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know the code, and Deak'd have it wired to blow if we so much as look at it funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we're... Hale looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I shouldn't've let you come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God. Hale takes Terry in his arms, holds her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I just hope someone remembers to feed my dog. Hale nods, hugs Terry. Terry starts to say something else, but Hale puts a finger to his lips -- he's heard something -- a distant rushing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. Hale pulls Terry, running, down the far tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you --?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said they shut down the mine when they hit an underground river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins slams the tailgate on the Humvee shut. From the distance, he and Pritchett hear the whump-whump-whump of a helicopter. Deakins motions Pritchett to stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins comes out, looks up, sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in. We're leaving.

direction.raw_text: (re: Kelly and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly is jarred when the elevator stops and the lights dim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins and Pritchett drive out of the mine in the Humvee. Deakins punches the trip odometer, setting it to zeroes.

direction.raw_text: Kelly switches on his headlamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wrong person to screw with, Deak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He pulls open the gate and climbs down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly swings under the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know the goddamn code, asshole. He grabs the cable trailing off below the elevator and starts sliding down it into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two minutes and counting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale and Terry are being sucked along through the fast, turbulent water. Their flashlights show...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jutting down like knives, ready-to rip then open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dodge them, push off, duck under. And then they notice that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is getting lower, getting closer to the surface of the water. They're running out of breathing room. Three feet, two feet, one foot. They take big breaths, maybe their last, and they're...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tumbling along, pulled at by the eddies, flashlights showing their faces -- they are running out of air. And then, there's light above them in the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lungs bursting, they start kicking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terry and Hale come to the surface, coughing, sucking in air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HUMVEE Deakins drives fast along the 4WD trail, glancing in his sideview mirror at...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Closing in on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is holding on tight as Deakins drives wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I've finally figured out your plan. Those guys in the helicopter are going to kill us, but we're going to rise from the dead and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very suddenly and very violently lashes out. The side of his hand hits Pritchett in the throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gags silently, suddenly unable to get any air. He pulls at his throat, even pounds himself in the back of the neck. No go. He slowly slumps, dying, skin turning blue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe now you'll shut up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly is running as fast as he can, headlamp lighting the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty seconds and counting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale and Terry are swimming toward the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins barrels along in the Humvee, the NEST helicopter getting closer behind him.

direction.raw_text: Deakins has a thought and looks over at Pritchett, dead, held up by the seatbelt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just realized I've never killed anyone before. I mean, I dropped bombs on Baghdad, but never face to face. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (thinks about it,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) I don't know what the big deal is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eighteen seconds left.

direction.raw_text: Runs up, starts entering numbers into the timer keypad.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him know we're here!

direction.raw_text: Deakins looks at...

direction.raw_text: Grins, steps on the brakes.

direction.raw_text: The Humvee stops and Deakins gets out, arms above his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hundred feet in the air, slowly coming in toward Deakins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eleven, ten, nine...

location: END OF TUNNEL ECU NUKE TIMER

direction.raw_text: Punches in the last two numbers of the code then ENTER.

direction.raw_text: It stops with seven seconds left. The amber light goes off and the red light comes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sits back on the floor, takes a breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins is watching the helicopter. Strangely, he is grinning. Then the camera CLOSES IN fast on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's holding a small black box. He presses a button and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly hears a click. He looks over at...

direction.raw_text: The red light goes out. The amber light comes on. A splitsecond later, the green light comes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit. The screen goes white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watching the helicopter, listening to Hunt over the loudspeaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Do not move or you will be fired -- THE GROUND Rises up beneath Deakins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ripples of the shockwave shoot out from the mine, shaking dust and dirt into the air with an incredible, deafening roar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fly ten feet into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a roar of static over everyone's headphones and then every light, every piece of electronic equipment shuts down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...! They plummet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terry and Hale are pulling themselves out of the water when the shockwave hits, knocking them off their feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilkins and Giles hear the sudden rumble and then the shockwave hits, knocking stuff off desks, swinging lamps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins and the Humvee land. In the b.g...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drops out of sight behind a rock formation. There's an explosion and a ball of fire shoots up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terry looks over at Hale -- holy shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lamps are still swinging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all we need. A goddamn earthquake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son, I was at the Nevada Test site in the fifties. That wasn't an earthquake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins picks himself up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to himself) At least I know they work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilkins grabs a phone. Giles is pacing, freaked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) Get me the Room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to get out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to be fine. It was underground. (into phone) Colonel Wilkins for General Creeley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For one thing, if it was above ground, it wouldn't have caused the same kind of ground tremor. For another, if it was above ground, we'd all be blind and dying. (into phone) Sir, we've just had a detonation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bedlam. People yelling. The Chairman is huddling with Baird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd that happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, but thank God it happened underground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First thing we do is put a huge goddamn lid on this thing. With all due respect to your boy Giles and his belief in honesty as the best policy, from now on and until the end of time, what happened in Utah tonight was an earthquake. All right? Baird nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Humvee races along the trail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins and the dead Pritchett motor along. Deakins turns to Pritchett as if Pritchett had just asked him a question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The helicopter? It was hit by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Electromagnetic pulse. It's released in a nuclear detonation. It wipes out anything electronic for miles. That"s another reason I wanted to set off a nuke. I knew it'd bring down any helicopters coming for us. It'll also shut down all radio communications for a few hours, which will severely screw up their response. (GRINS) You see, Mr. Pritchett? There really is nothing for you to worry about. Pritchett's body seems to nod from the motion of the Humvee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hover and dance over the water in the early morning light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale has his shirt off and is wringing it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Goddamn it! He turns to see Terry trying to undo her buttons but unable to her fingers are too numb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stupid buttons. I hate these shirts. They're ugly and stupid and -- Terry suddenly starts crying. It's not the shirt she's upset about. Hale holds her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just ... I mean, we almost...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A nuclear bomb went off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That it did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. (points at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) If the butterflies are okay, then we'll be okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely. It says so in the manual. "If you see butterflies after a detonation, you are fine." Terry looks at Hale. She knows he's bullshitting her, but she appreciates it. They look at each other. They could kiss ... but they both shy away from it. Terry gets her shirt off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We better get moving. We might be able to reach Deakins when he gets to the river. They start off along a trail by the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something I've been meaning to ask. (Terry looks at him) How did someone like you end up with a gun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hit a bankrobber with a frozen chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came out here one summer during college. It was the campaign to stop the dam in the Grand Canyon. I loved it here. I came back, worked as a river guide and eventually stayed year-round. When a Park Ranger job came open, I applied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm still waiting for the chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The local Parks Department wasn't sure how I'd do with the law enforcement part of the job. Well, one night I was coming home from the store and Tommy Drewson part of the local brain trust was robbing old Bob Kearney in front of the ATM. I bear old Bob yelling and I see Tommy heading for his car, so I tossed a bag of groceries at him at thirty miles an hour. A frozen chicken in the bag hit him in the forehead and he dropped like a rock. Next thing I know, I'm a Ranger. Hale looks at Terry with a new appreciation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins pilots the Humvee along the trail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale and Terry are crouching behind a rock, looking down.

direction.raw_text: Get me a frozen Zacky's fryer and he's a dead man. There's the sound of an approaching engine. Sheppard stands, gun ready. The engine stops. A few seconds later...

direction.raw_text: Appears, walking down a footpath toward Sheppard.

direction.raw_text: Where is everyone?

direction.raw_text: I am everyone. Let's go. Sheppard hurries to Deakins. They disappear up the footpath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're the only ones who know what's going on, and I don't have the faintest idea how we're gonna stop them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll think of something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you say that?

direction.raw_text: You have so far. Hale looks at Terry -- she's right. But it almost pisses him off more than it gives him confidence. He grumbles to himself and starts off down toward the raft.

direction.raw_text: Sink it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steal it. They get down to the raft. They climb in. Hale grabs the engine throttle, slumps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keys. Hale looks around, spots Sheppard's duffel bag lying on the riverbank. He hops out and starts rummaging through it when they hear grunting and feet approaching. Hale looks around for a place to hide. There isn't any. Terry tries to get out of the raft, but she trips on a tarpaulin bunched on the bottom of the raft. she drops.

direction.raw_text: Coming down a path, lugging the last remaining nuke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of the raft. Hale and Terry are nowhere to be seen.

direction.raw_text: Is alone, in the water, on the far side of the raft, very silent. He hears Deakins and Sheppard load the nuke into the raft.

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Why were you driving around with a dead guy?

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Because I like him. He doesn't ask a lot of annoying questions. All right? A few seconds later the engine starts up. Hale ducks down under water as the raft takes off over him. He surfaces to watch the raft zooming off into the distance. He is very worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MOVING The nuke is on a pallet in the middle of the raft. Sheppard pilots the raft. Deakins looks around, sees what he wants.

direction.raw_text: Is lying on the deck of the raft along one side, all bunched up. It'd be the kind of thing you'd hide under.

direction.raw_text: Grabs the tarp and pulls.

direction.raw_text: Strapped to one of the side pontoons. A small triangle of cloth is sticking out from inside the crate -- like the corner of a shirt. It's quickly pulled out of sight from within.

direction.raw_text: Hale climbs out of the water and looks around, not knowing quite what to do.

direction.raw_text: The zodiac boat is on the shore. Sheppard and four man -- call them the GUNMEN -- are hauling the nuke to the truck. Deakins walks with another man -- MAX, 50s. Max checks his watch.

direction.raw_text: Your friends in Washington should be getting the package about now.

direction.raw_text: I wish I could see their faces.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... two-hundred-and-fifty million dollars, by nine a.m. Utah time. The depositing instructions are in the envelope that came with this tape. This deadline is not negotiable, and there is no grace period. The device is on a timer. Shortly after you receive this, the timer will be activated. At nine a.m., I will make a call. If I find out you've done as you've been told, I will stop the timer. If you have not complied -- The screen suddenly cuts to a flurry of images of nuclear destruction -- buildings being knocked sideways, mushroom clouds, shockwaves, fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn that off!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale runs along the shoreline, headed for...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where houseboats are rented out. Hale's eyes focus on a sign with a picture of a phone on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The back gate of the truck is shut from the inside. The truck starts up and rumbles off, slowly at first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jumps up from the raft and runs after the truck, staying right behind. She grabs a handhold and pulls herself up. She holds on tight as the truck bounces off down the dirt road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loud voices and crosstalk. Baird is on the phone, nodding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. Creeley's phone rings. He answers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Creeley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (covers phone; to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) The President wants to know if we know where the device is headed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If Deakins had a plane waiting, it could be anywhere. We just don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. (all eyes on him) Major Hale is alive. According to him, Colonel Deakins is headed for Salt Lake City.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Army helicopters are landing near the marina. Two are already down. One has TROOPS standing outside of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are walking toward the second helicopter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We found the raft on the other side of the lake. Tracks from a heavy truck ran out when they hit the paved road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we get a rad scanner we can track them. A brief look between Wilkins and Giles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, Major, we're going back to McMurran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd just like to ask you a few questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not wasting time answering questions. We've got -- WILKINS No debate, Major. I was given orders. Now, you can come with us, or you can go with them. Wilkins nods over at the other helicopter. The troops standing in front of it are MPs. Hale looks at Wilkins, astounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilkins is up front with the pilot. Hale and Giles are in back. All wear headsets. Hale is yelling at Wilkins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins thinks I'm dead. He thinks it's over. You've got to let me go after him. I can help. I know how his mind works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Major, I know this is personal for you, but I think we can handle it. We're putting a wall of men and machines around Salt Lake City as we speak. That truck is not getting through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TRUCK CLOSE ON THE NUCLEAR WEAPON Dusty slices of light come through the truck's slatted walls. The nuclear weapon is lashed to a hammock, straps running off to D-rings on the sides. Max is hooking up an electronic timer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the Ranger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you find that truck, you'll hit it hard. Chances are she'll be killed in the crossfire. "Regrettable but unavoidable."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Giles and Wilkins share a look -- Hale is right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, she's not supposed to be there. She should be checking camping permits, finding lost kids. She... (BEAT) She saved my life. Giles wants to help. So does Wilkins, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were ordered to take you back to McMurran. You understand what orders are, don't you, Major? Wilkins turns away. Hale sits back, mind racing, not knowing what to do. He quickly grabs a pistol from the helicopter's weapons rack and puts it to Wilkin's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Major, put that away or say goodbye to your career and hello to twenty years in Leavenworth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If that's what it takes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to shoot me. Hale thinks, but there's no way he can do that. He lowers the gun, sits back. Giles gets Hale's attention, then points to his own head. Hale doesn't understand, so Giles grabs Hale's gunhand and puts the gun up to his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colonel! How about this? Wilkins looks back, sees Hale holding the gun to Giles' head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bad acting) I swear to God I'll shoot. Wilkins grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Max finishes hooking up the timer. He looks at Deakins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready when you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait until I get back. I'm going to check on Sheppard. Deakins goes to a ladder that leads up to the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hale is looking back and forth between what he sees out the window and the map on his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're looking for, Major. Every road between here and salt Lake has already been sealed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deak would know that. Maybe he's not on the road. Wilkins doesn't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were using maps like these to set up the roadblocks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then that's the answer. Wilkins doesn't understand. Hale points outside, down at...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the ground. Old ones, half-covered by weeds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an old spur. Probably hasn't been used in twenty years. Nobody bothered to put it on the new maps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you --?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The nuke isn't in a truck, Colonel. It's on a train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A freight train -- engine, a car carrier (carrying a load of Toyotas), several boxcars and a caboose. A hatch opens up an the roof of one of the boxcars near the tail of the train and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climbs out and we discover that indeed they are not in a truck, they're in a train. The "nuke boxcar" has a small satellite dish mounted on the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are in position at points along the train, ready with Uzis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilkins hangs up the radio mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Radio's still down. We'll head north, look for a phone, then look for a train. Giles nods. Hale is thinking. Wilkins starts to tell the pilot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Go south.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Salt Lake is north.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not going to Salt Lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you said it would be Salt Lake. You found that hospital tag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He planted that. He wanted whoever found it to think that's where he was going. (Shakes head) He's been doing a rope-a-dope. Giles and Wilkins look at him like he's nuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a boxing term. When Ali -- Look, I know this guy. If everything has been saying he's heading north, then he's heading south. They look at him, then Wilkins grabs the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's south of here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wilkins' finger follows the train line on the map. It goes right into Las Vegas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not Vegas. What the hell is there to blow up in Vegas? Wilkins' finger keeps moving on the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The President. Wilkins' finger stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins jumps the gap between two boxcars and walks on. We
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN to reveal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crouching down between the two cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheppard is working with a torch, welding the brake and accelerator controls. Deakins enters. Sheppard turns the torch down. Deakins lights a cigarette off it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much longer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind the driver's compartment is the engine itself, with walkways along either side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Creeps-up to one of the doors that lead into the driver's compartment. She hears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) How long until the helicopter gets here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five minutes. We'll leave from the boxcar roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Deakins turns to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deakins opens the door and strides along beside the engine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is hiding on the other side of the engine, very quiet and still. As Deakins goes out the back door of the engine, Terry follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terry comes out the door and is about to step across to the ladder on the boxcar when we PULL BACK to reveal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he puts a gun to the back of Terry's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes out of the mini-mart with a cup of coffee and heads for his old pickup truck. He starts to open his door when he hears, incongruously, whump-whump-whump. He looks up as...
